title: Space Force briefing on military space race catches Jeff Bezos’ attention
summary: U.S. Space Systems Command officials earlier this month gave an unclassified briefing to Blue Origin founder Jeff Bezos on the power competition taking place in the space domain.

title: Starlink taking preorders for high-speed private jet broadband service
summary: SpaceX started accepting preorders Tuesday from high-flying private jet owners willing to pay a hefty price to receive high-speed Starlink services in the air.

title: UK defense committee calls for thorough Eutelsat/OneWeb review
summary: Eutelsat and OneWeb’s planned merger requires the “strictest possible scrutiny,” a cross-party group of British government officials said in a report warning the U.K has become a “third-rank” power in space post-Brexit.

title: NASA to Discuss Science on Next Northrop Grumman Space Station Mission
summary: NASA will host a media teleconference at 11 a.m. EDT on Tuesday, Oct. 25, to discuss the next science investigations, technology demonstrations, crew supplies, and hardware bound for the International Space Station aboard Northrop Grumman’s Cygnus spacecraft on the company’s 18th commercial resupply mission for NASA.

title: Ariane 6 debut slips to end of 2023, teams prep for Combined Test
summary: The debut of Europe’s new heavy-lift launcher, Ariane 6, has slipped once again, this time to a no-earlier-than target of the “last quarter of 2023.”

title: Ariane 6 first launch slips to late 2023
summary: The European Space Agency has again delayed the first flight of Europe’s Ariane 6 launch vehicle, this time to late 2023, as the new vehicle makes slow progress to the launch pad.

title: Curiosity Mars Rover Reaches Long-Awaited Salty Region
summary: After years of climbing, the Mars rover has arrived at a special region believed to have formed as Mars’ climate was drying.

title: Canada to contribute satellite and instruments to NASA-led Earth science mission
summary: The Canadian government announced Oct. 18 it will fund development of a satellite and instruments for a NASA-led Earth science program.

title: SpaceX slashes base price of smallsat rideshare program, adds “Plates”
summary: SpaceX has rolled out an upgraded version of its Rideshare program that will allow even more small satellite operators to send their...

title: SDA slide reveals Tranche 0 optical terminal manufacturers
summary: “I'm going to do competitions for every Tranche, every layer, every time and it's going to be full and open,” Space Development Agency director Derek Tournear said. “The only way we can do that is if I make sure all the satellites work together as a network."
